abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Project Completion Report
            for the Ceara Second Rural Development Project and Minas
            Gerais Second Rural Development Project in Brazil. The
            overall objectives of both projects included: increasing
            productivity and incomes; broadening employment
            opportunities and generally improving the standard of living
            of farm families and small-scale non-agricultural
            enterprises; and increasing agriculture and rural industry
            production for local and export markets; and improving
            physical and social infrastructure. The Main lessons drawn
            from the projects are: (a) the size and scope/complexity of
            a project needs to be matched to existing institutional
            capacities and to the available financial resources; (b) the
            political, sociological and technical constraints to
            facilitate changes, both in the effectiveness of public
            sector institutions, as well as in behavior of
            beneficiaries, need to be realistically assessed; (c)
            success of investment projects depends critically on
            availability of viable , agricultural technologies and, in
            the case of small farmers, of credit; (d) successful land
            distribution is a multi-faceted issue which cannot be
            handled effectively as a minor project component, especially
            in a politically volatile environment; (e) successful
            project design and implementation requires the participation
            of beneficiaries in project preparation; and (f) Bank
            supervision needs to: (i) reinforce suitable impact
            evaluation procedures including the establishment of
            baseline data; and (ii) pay sufficient attention to
            technical aspects of project implementation.
